intro: Corydalis dajingensis, commonly known as the Dajing Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, often pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas. It has slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its blooming period usually occurs in spring, adding a splash of color to its natural habitat.
